docTitle.titlePart:
HERMETIC INTEGRATION OF LIQUIDS IN MEMS BY ROOM
TEMPERATURE, HIGH-SPEED PLUGGING OF LIQUID-FILLED CAVITIES
AT WAFER LEVEL

byline.docAuthor: M. Antelius, A.C. Fischer, F. Niklaus, G. Stemme and N. Roxhed

front.div:
ABSTRACT
This paper reports a novel room temperature hermetic
liquid sealing process based on wire bonded "plugs" over the
access ports of liquid-filled cavities. The method enables liq-
uids to be integrated already at the fabrication stage. Test
vehicles were manufactured and used to investigate the me-
chanical and hermetic properties of the seals. A helium leak
rate of better than 10 −10 mbarL/s was measured on the suc-
cessfully sealed structures. The bond strength of the "plugs"
were similar to standard wire bonds on flat surfaces.
